summary: The Theodore Roosevelt Presidential Library Museum Artifacts Act authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to provide grants (up to $50 million) to the Theodore Roosevelt Presidential Library Foundation in Medora, North Dakota, for the library's establishment. The grants are contingent on the Foundation matching the funds with at least $100 million from non-federal sources. The bill also allows the Secretary to loan historical artifacts and objects from federal agencies to the Foundation for display. Federal involvement in the library's operation is prohibited, except at the Foundation’s request.
